Reviews.Title: “The good, bad and ugly”
Reviews.Author: GTRMAN69
Reviews.Content: The good: clean room, quiet floor, great location. The Bad: Refused early check in when called, didn't even ask for reservation number. No check in available for Priority Card Holders, only one front desk person until check in line got really long. I being a Priority card holder with reservations stood in line behind people without reservations and they actually got a room while I had to wait even longer for mine to be ready. Room listed with 2 double beds, more like single full sized beds...... The ugly: Rooms not ready at check in time of 3pm, super long line for check in due to not having the rooms ready. Asked maid for towels, she took room number and never showed up. Had to call front desk for towels, they showed up the 2nd time. No view worth mentioning. The only other positive was they approved a late check out, only because that is the policy for Priority club members.

Reviews.Title: “best place to stay”
Reviews.Author: leosee
Reviews.Content: this is the best place i have stayed in, in Chicago. friendly and always ready to serve.but they need free coffee in the am. Leon S

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel on Lots of Levels”
Reviews.Author: Marcia C
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for quick in and out stops back at "the room" while in Chicago. Staff is OUTSTANDING and friendly. Very responsive. Harold Rodgers was extremely helpful in several capacities, acting as our "Go To" man on several occasions. He was thoughtful and kind without being intrusive in any way, always on the look out for the best interests of each individual guests, whatever they may be. Rooms are fine - a good value for the cost. (You're not staying at the Taj Mahal.) Noise from the street is barely audible and we even had a room on the traffic-side of the hotel. We will return here in a heartbeat and send our friends as well.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best but served its purposes”
Reviews.Author: fallingleaf21
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel because it had very good access to the CTA and was 5 minute walk to the AMTRAK station. It was very convenient to get around town because the CTA station was literally within 1 block. The hotel itself seems a little older and not recently renovated. The hotel staff was adequately nice. The room was unremarkable (not excellent but not below average). The ambience was not romantic or special at all. I got a great deal here so I'd probably stay again due to the convenience of public transport and quick access to the AMTRAK station.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: TrypGuru
Reviews.Content: Upon checking in to the hotel the valet guy was rude and showed little concern for assisting us. I was on the 5th floor and had difficulty finding my room because the numbering makes no sense. When I finally found my room my keys didn't work so I had to go back down and get re-keyed. My fiancÃ© and I had plans and didn't return to the hotel until almost 2am at which point we had to search for a valet person (that we spent $35 on) and some guy tried jumping into the car with the valet so I questioned the sketchy character and he tried to fight me until my 6 foot 3 fiancÃ© stepped in and the loser backed down. All the manager had to say was sorry. Then the sheets in my non-smoking room reeked of cigarette smoke and we had to listen to our loud neighbors next door play music ALL night and "celebrate" their love thanks to the paper thin walls. Worst hotel stay ever.

Reviews.Title: “Union Station Oasis”
Reviews.Author: TimAlbany_NY
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Holiday Inn Downtown Chicago roughly every year for the past ten, and have never been disappointed. Located a short 2.5 blocks from the Union Station, south down Canal St., this motel is sits by itself on the west side, far from hotels in the Loop or along Michigan Avenue to the north. For those arriving by train at Union Station, or by Greyhound two blocks directly west, this place is a real find. No long taxi rides to expensive rooms. Most recent stay was January 31, 2012 for $137.56 (tax included) in an immaculate suite that included bedroom, sitting room and working desk, kitchenette, and a spotless bathroom. Check in was quick and check out was automatic by depositing keys in a front desk box. A spacious lobby, a clean Laundromat and a restaurant complete the picture. One little irritation is that the suite faced both busy Canal St. and the Eisenhower Expressway, the latter of which generates a mild rumble at all times which quickly becomes light background noise. Personnel have always been friendly, efficient and accommodating. Prices rise on weekends and as the season becomes milder, but for one arriving by train or bus, or driving in on the Expressway (take Canal St. exit, next right on Harrison St. and then an immediate right into the motel parking lot), what more can you ask for? And the winter price of $137.56 per night can't be beat unless you decide to sleep on a Union Station bench, and they close at 1.00A.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel...”
Reviews.Author: wwinkley
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was nice, although it did have a smell to it... something along the lines over stale air freshener. The pizza place next to it was extremely salty and the service was sub par too. My room was a nice size, average bed, tiny bathroom. I would recommend the hotel for sure, just note do not eat next store.

Reviews.Title: “Another good visit”
Reviews.Author: Donna w
Reviews.Content: This is our third visit to Holiday Inn Downtown. The morning and evening concierge are very helpful and courteous. Sean is especially helpful and friendly. By now when we arrive they call us by name. When we ask for a wake up call, it's on time, ask for a cab, it's on time. All in all, a very satisfactory place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch concierge”
Reviews.Author: s o
Reviews.Content: Both the morning and the evening concierge were the best I've ever had. The most helpful, friendly staff I've had while traveling. Help me stow my bags on the way in and on the way out since the timing was out of alignment with check-in/checkout. First time in Chicago and they steered me perfectly for directions, bus numbers, train lines, great sightseeing ideas, great bar and restaurant recommendations, and just enjoyable guys to talk to. I hope they are both there when I return,because i will because of them. Location to subway, 100 yds awesome, location to busses, some 100yds, some 2 blocks, again awesome, very short walk form Amtrak station!

Reviews.Title: “what to expect”
Reviews.Author: kazinia
Reviews.Content: There is a package for $20, in addition to your room rate, that covers breakfast each day, as well as, valet parking ... the latter is about $30 - $40 elsewhere downtown. This was the bait that lured us in.The rates are very reasonable. It's not a 5 star hotel so there are llittle things that show wear and tear ... crack in the area below the sink, no thermaostat ... had one of those older AC/heat things by the window, etc. BUT .. the convenience, price and staff made up for these little things as we were there for 6 nights. The breakfast off the menu at the pizza restaurant worried me before we got there but it was cooked to order; it was just fine. One evening we returned to see our room did not get made up and upon request it was cleaned and made up before we returned that night. Seems like the staff has a "we'll get right on it" attitude. Business center and work out rooms more than adequate!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice experience Tim C”
Reviews.Author: Tim C
Reviews.Content: I've had alot of business in Chicago the past 7 months and have been staying at this hotel almost every week. Every one of the staff is helpful and works to make my stay pleasant. They greet me by name as soon as I walk in the door on Monday. The hotel itself is a little above average. Prices are comparable to others in the area. The restaurant is good. Alina and Idalia especially take care of anything I need. Dwayne and the others are super. I'll be staying here until my project ends in another few weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: doug r
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn downtown was very reasonably priced and the service was exceptional. Everyone there was friendly with the exception of Adrienne. She was disrespectful, rude, and downright mean. Everyone else was very friendly and eager to help including Alina, Dwayne the bellman and Dwayne the bartender. The food in the hotel restaurant was top notch. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay there, with the exception of my interactions with Adrienne Eisenhour, and would recommend it to anyone staying in Chicago and going to the downtown attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Jill provides outstanding service...”
Reviews.Author: Garland S
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Holiday Inn last week and I'll be here through the end of this week. Jill has provided outstanding service. She is helpful, pleasant, and friendly - everything one could expect. Her pleasant demeanor has made my stay here very enjoyable. Thank you, Garland Smith

Reviews.Title: “So nice had to stay twice!”
Reviews.Author: ageebabe
Reviews.Content: Chose to stay here on two trips to Chicago! Great location...great view of the Willis Tower from the roof top pool! The staff are so friendly & welcoming. Clean, affordable hotel! Great for the kids. My daughter LOVED the outdoor pool on the roof! Definitely will be staying here again

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Camala C
Reviews.Content: The staff was amazing! Harold even pulled bus route information for me. The hotel was very clean. I walked to a conference 1 1/2 miles away and felt very safe. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Visiting my grandson in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Ken P
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, great greeting and all accommodations including the room were right on par with a nice 3 star hotel. Front staff were very polite and helpful. Would definately stay again at this hotel. Great value for the dollar and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff & Attentive Manager”
Reviews.Author: Stuart T
Reviews.Content: Marty, the duty manager, could not do enough to help us. Unlike many hotel managers, he was always walking around his hotel, assisting his guests. Staff were very friendly & eager to please. Huge room, if dated. Great location. Would stay again. Stuart & Judith T.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: John C
Reviews.Content: Helpful Frienldy Staff!! Clean and neat. Close to subway and reasonable walk to the parks and waterfront. Good value for downtown. Will stay again on next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Our hotel of choice next trip to Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Vicki G
Reviews.Content: First time at this hotel but not our last. Very convenient to the subway and easy to find. Very friendly staff. I'm glad Sean answered the phone when I called for directions from airport. He was also helpful by giving us directions to the sites we wanted to see. Comfortable room, quiet and service was great. Had dinner at the restaurant next door; dinner was delicious and service good. When we go back to Chicago, this will be our "base" location.

Reviews.Title: “very convenient”
Reviews.Author: Donna w
Reviews.Content: Our first time at this Holiday Inn but definitely will be back. Rooms do need redoing and bathroom needs exhaust fan but to spend a night great. Front staff, especialy Sean super nice and helpful. Love valet parking and convenience of calling cab to go to the hospital for treatment. Easily accessible from expressway. Dinner very good in restaurant. Love that it's right there and we don't have to walk anyplace outside hotel for meals.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad... .”
Reviews.Author: jaitravel
Reviews.Content: This is an older Holiday Inn with a great location in the center of downtown Chicago. Parking is valet only at $30 per day! Breakfast is very nice and not included in the price of the room. The whole hotel would be much nicer if it were renovated. The hallways and the rooms themselves do not have very good lighting giving the hotel a dark feeling. The room I had was of good size with two queen beds. The room was quiet even though it was located close to the street. The carpet from the entrance to just past the bathroom (which is on the right just inside) is very worn. The bathroom is small and awkward. You have to dance with the door to use the toilet and shower. The bathroom has all the standard amenities you would expect. The bed is not the most comfortable in the world and the pillows are lumpy. The room in general is clean and I feel the housekeepers do a good job. The furnishings in the room are well maintained and everything works as it should. Internet connectivity is good. The front desk staff and valet's provide good service. You can tell they care and are interested in the quality of your stay. I liked this hotel. Not a bad choice.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Blaize76
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located near Greek town and The Loop with a Blue Line stop just outside the parking lot. The staff is always very friendly (my second time here) and accommodating. The rooms are quiet, but definitely in need of a makeover. Bed was ok in comfort, but certainly not the softest I have slept in. Only two annoying things happened, one is that the bathroom was not stocked with shampoo, conditioner, lotion and two soaps and the light switch next to the bed stopped working. By no means did the seriously detract from the overall experience, but it did show that the hotel needs some work. Especially the elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Good Last Minute Help”
Reviews.Author: williamselizab1
Reviews.Content: Our electricity was out so we needed somewhere to stay last minute. Curtis was at the desk and very helpful in terms of giving us room size options and what floor we preferred. All of the service provided from the hotel was great, and the parking provided was extremely convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great location when doing business in the Chicago area”
Reviews.Author: metroarena
Reviews.Content: I am a seasoned traveler and I would highly recommend this property in downtown Chicago. The Hotel is clean and business traveler friendly. The staff goes out of their way to make you feel welcomed...especially Dwayne the front end staff member.He makes the the experience even better! The restaurant at the hotel is perfect for a quick meal and the bar serves up a great pizza if you want to catch the game at night. Overall a great time...

Reviews.Title: “Will be back!”
Reviews.Author: BigGus79
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our anniversary and all was great. We rode the Amtrak train into town and this hotel was within walking distance from the station. While we were there, we stayed in a two-room suite which was nice. The staff was very sincere and helpful. They recommended a romantic spot for dinner and even called a cab for us. We will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Chicago!!!”
Reviews.Author: msu88
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Chicago. I took my family for a mini vacation the front desk was very friendly they had great suggestions on what to do and were to go. The entire staff was very helpfull in every aspect we forgot a couple of stuff we called down and they quickly brought them up. Overall we had no complains it was a memorable experience we would love to go back. A very special thanks to those who made our trip a success Denise,Harold,Jeff. Thank you all!

Reviews.Title: “Walking distance from Union Station”
Reviews.Author: Chrisjoyy
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel because it was only a block from Union station and we could just walk there. The price was higher than other hotels but I figured for the convience it was worth it. Sean at the front desk was nice and gave us an upgrade on our room so we ended up with a nice suite. I got the breakfast voucher for 2 people which was good for up to $20 but then found out that the breakfast buffet was $13 each so had to pay extra for breakfast anyways. I think it would have been nice to just offer the buffet in the package. Overall we liked the hotel and would stay there again. We didn't get to spend much time there as we got in on the Megabus in the evening, next morning went to the Rosie O'Donnell show and met my favorite actress, Melissa Gilbert (aka Laura Ingals) and then hopped on the megabus home again. What a fun 2 day adventure:)

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Ljubince
Reviews.Content: We got the room through priceline ($70 per night) and it was all worth it. Close to all attractions, clean, the hotel staff was helpful and friendly. Even though didn't have much choice about the room (since we got it through priceline), we got what we wanted (king bed and non-smoking). You have to pay $30 per night for parking, but again, all worth it- you get valet parking anytime and $5 off per night if you sign up for rewards (free sign up). Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel's staff and service!”
Reviews.Author: Linell S
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel are super!!! Especially "Sean" , "Julio, & "Harold. Each of them were so very friendly and offered to help my friend and I find the right buses to different areas, suggest sites, and quickly get us taxi's as needed. We were not thrilled with the location as it was a ways from the loop & downtown areas....but for the value and the excellent service and clean room we would stay here again and recommend to others. THANKS "Sean, Julio, and Harold for making our trip to your beautiful city so very, very special!!!

Reviews.Title: “Average -- nothing great”
Reviews.Author: drsanapk
Reviews.Content: We visited chicago during the labour day weekend and booked this hotel via priceline. N got 80$ rate . Although for that rate i had no complains whatso ever with location and room as the room was decent size n furniture was ok too. Bathroom was small but it was acceptably clean. The front desk staff was good n efficient . Our check in and check out both were prompt . Valet parking was 30 $ so we parked in adjacent parking lot ( with in/out privilage ) in 20$ . Breakfast is nt included . . Overall till that point it is satisfactory hotel . The issue i had is with housekeeping. They are not efficient enough . Even theey were worse than. 2 star hotel . On my 2 nd night they even didnt refill the towels , toiletaries and disposables . With very unsatisfactory cleaning. For that reason alone i would not recommend that hotel to any body else.

Reviews.Title: “WE loved it and would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: AML848
Reviews.Content: My sister and I were traveling and unable to get back east after the hurricane Irene. Traveling by train, from Union Station, just outside the station we could see a Holiday Inn. WE took a chance and walked to this hotel. We we were delighted. The staff was VERY friendly and helpful. The hotel was clean. The attached restaurant was excellent. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Comformtable, convenient and hospitable”
Reviews.Author: Joe M
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed the trip to Chicago and my stay at the Holiday Inn downtown. The rooms were good, fitness area was what I needed, but more so, the staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Marisa Z
Reviews.Content: WARNING!!!!!! DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!! Stayed here with friends and all woke up with bed bug bites! There were 5 of us in the room and each of us had horrible bite marks all over our body. I do not recommend this place to anybody. It is DISGUSTING! Very dirty with bed bugs!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: M H
Reviews.Content: The hotel was located close to the El (Blue Line), but got me a cab in zero time, and was five blocks from Union Station. The staff (especially Salina and Mae) were extremely helpful and professional. They knew every feature that was worth mentioning and were helpful but not chatty so they could help other guests. The restaurant in the hotel was very good too...just had pizza and salad.

Reviews.Title: “The staff was amazing and beyond helpful. Roof top pool too!”
Reviews.Author: JRK28970
Reviews.Content: I was very happy when I stayed here. The man working at the front desk... Sean was so helpful and funny. The hotel itself was clean. The best part is a roof top pool and a fitness room. They also have a business center. There is a pizza place NEXT DOOR that brings you food to your room if you want. Good prices. Anyways for the money you spend it is totally worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service is one of the best in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: aldodsol
Reviews.Content: We stayed for Market Days weekend in this wonderful property. Since we arrived all the stuff was so helpful and polite, specially Mei and Letisha. They provided all kind of help including directions, and explanation of amenities. The location is great is just a few blocks away from Sears Tower and 1 block away from the blue line. I really recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Agreat place as a base to visit Chicago for the first time”
Reviews.Author: chistinewalker2009
Reviews.Content: A very well run moderately priced hotel. The room was very well serviced with confortable beds. The food was tasty and freshly cooked. The staff did everything they could to make our stay in the hotel and our siteseeing enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible - 3 strikes”
Reviews.Author: c87654321
Reviews.Content: strike 1 - Ants in the room, complained to the desk and nothing done strike 2 - staples sticking out of a chair in the room cut my wife's leg, at least they removed the staples after we complained. strike 3 - room not cleaned well and mold and rotten door in the bathroom

Reviews.Title: “a good choice at a good price”
Reviews.Author: travelerneedsclean
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for a gathering with our children and grandchildren because it had many good reviews (on TripAdvisor and other sites), it was close to public transportation and Union Station, it had a pool, and the price was right. The room was spacious and clean, the staff were helpful and friendly, and the kids loved the pool. The hotel is less than a block from the Clinton stop on the Blue Line train, which we used frequently, and bus stops are nearby. We walked from Union Station after arriving on Amtrak. It's in the financial district, so we really did have to venture out a bit for most restaurants and shopping, as a number of reviews mentioned. We enjoyed pizza one evening from the restaurant in the hotel, however. I advise skipping the breakfast in that restaurant, though -- it's bland and overpriced. We had asked for a quiet room since the building borders a highway and a busy street -- we still heard a fair amount of street noise, but it didn't keep us awake. I would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “above average with some issues”
Reviews.Author: Momwith5kids
Reviews.Content: Clean room, friendly staff, nice size of elevators and rooms, and close to several things in walking distance. However, you don't want to walk in certain directions because we had some vagrants confront us twice on the north side of the hotel only. Parking is extremely tight for a big car or minivan, and we witnessed a full size pickup truck try to turn in the parking garage ramp and dent his vehicle on a concrete pylon (too tight for huge truck). The notorious reputation for driving in the center of this city is true--park your car and take a cab anywhere you need to go! Easier and faster and less stressful than trying to negotiate the streets as a tourist. I liked this hotel becasue it was very clean, and had plenty of space, and the pool was elevated on the top of the fourth or fifth floor so that was a novelty for our group. However, it was a crowded pool. I like the honking, and busy noises of the inner city so it lulled me to sleep and was pretty, but some people may not get a good nights sleep with the hubub of the inner city. I liked this hotel, but I would probably stay somewhere else due to traffic and vagrants next time.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever. BED BUGS!”
Reviews.Author: KGTravel24
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Holiday Inn earlier this month for over a week and it was the worst experience. This hotel is horribly located, next to a blighted building in a dingy area very out of the way. The staff is hit or miss but mostly unresponsive. And I found A BED BUG crawling all over me at 2AM one morning. I killed the little sucker and set it aside as proof then went down to the lobby. The hotel moved us to their last available room that night and "inspected" the room in the morning. They told me there were no bed bugs. That the one I killed THAT NIGHT had been dead for awhile. Anyone who knows anything about bed bugs (as I unfortunately do now) knows this is an absurd justification. If there is one, old or new, there are probably hundreds. I made the hotel dry clean and wash all my clothes, but they were very reluctant to do so. Not only that, but in my sleepy state I forgot a couple of small but sentimental items in the infested room. I asked for them the next day. Then the next. And the next after that. And so on for the rest of my stay until the minute I got in a cab to leave for the airport. Nothing. The hotel all but ignored me and I never got my stuff back. I'm sure they put someone else back in the infested room. So, a week later and I have bites all over my stomach. I can't keep my mouth shut anymore. I will never ever stay here again and I recommend that you find another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast included - sorta”
Reviews.Author: quilter309
Reviews.Content: I reserved the room including breakfast for two adults, and "kids eat free." When I asked at the front desk about the gold paper to give to the restaurant, they informed me that it was actually for $20 toward breakfast. We had two adults and one child. The buffet is $13 + beverages per person. They did honor "kids eat free", except for the chocolate milk. Obviously false advertising, as in addition it cost me $7.50.

Reviews.Title: “great staff and a unique rooftop pool”
Reviews.Author: ilovelowly
Reviews.Content: We were greeted right away by the front desk person, Tommie, who was very welcoming. He made sure everything was taken care of and was just overall great. The room (a suite) was small but clean and perfectly fine. The rooftop pool was wonderful, surrounded by chairs and very breezy which was welcome in super-steamy Chicago. The food in the attached restaurant is also very good, we ate there twice. Good pizza, excellent spaghetti! Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced but great staff”
Reviews.Author: matrix869
Reviews.Content: My stay here was not horrible, but was definitely not worth the price charged. The bathroom was extremely tiny to say the least. The location was not ideal since I was hoping to walk to the Rush & Division section of Chicago, but it was too far. A good part of that was my lack of knowledge of downtown Chicago. You will have to pay for parking. The one shining star was the staff! They were, to the person, extremely friendly, helpful, and courteous! Excellent job by the staff!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location very friendly!”
Reviews.Author: westmc9th
Reviews.Content: WOW what can i say out of all the places i have stayed this is one of the top hotels it had so many friendly people wanting to help you at all times! Room was decent and view of Sears/ Willis tower from pool is breath taking

Reviews.Title: “Third Shift Crew works miracles!”
Reviews.Author: Tenderb36
Reviews.Content: I made a last minute 12:30am reservation with Priority Club Rewards and it was a disaster. The dates were wrong and I did not realize it until arriving the hotel. The young ladies at this Holiday Inn worked diligently to resolve my issue. Within 15 minutes I had GREAT room for two nights. The room was super clean, bed super soft and excellent experience.

Reviews.Title: “THIS PLACE REALLY WORKED OUT WELL FOR US.”
Reviews.Author: mlouapre
Reviews.Content: We originally selected this hotel due to its' proximity to the United Center to attend the Farewell Show for Oprah. It was very convenient to the train from the airport (MIdway). Staff was extremely friendly and nice, especially the bellman who always graciously assisted us with getting a cab and directions. Our room was comfortable, quiet, clean and had a new bathroom with new towels as well. The restaurant served us well, and the food was fine. Breakfast was extremely good (the buffet) and well-worth the money. Also, the hotel was convenient to buses as well - a great location - and we enjoyed our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Safe”
Reviews.Author: FigPow
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Holiday Inn for 2 nights while in Chcago on business. The hotel was very clean and looked pretty well maintained. Front desk staff were friendly and very helpful. Breakfast at the adjoining restaurant was good. The only negative comment I have is about the traffic noise which I could hear in my room. My room faced the entrace to a highway underpass and I could hear some traffic noise early in the morning. If you are a light sleeper I would sugget you ask for a room on the other side of the hotel. Overall I think my stay at this Holiday Inn was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Very Accommodating!”
Reviews.Author: jamkridia
Reviews.Content: We would definitely stay here again. The staff was very nice and extremely helpful. If we needed anything, they took care of us right away. We had plenty of space for our family of 5 to move about when we were in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: funboy69
Reviews.Content: I wish a staff would have told me about the fitness center. I travel a lot and the fitness center is a big part in where I stay, I learned about the fitness center from reading in my room what amenity were offered. This isn't a negative against the staff who checked me in on that day.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Wililam
Reviews.Content: Convenient location, good price, helpful staff, great pizza, near Sears Tower, 1 block from Clinton Station Chicago Transit Authority station.

Reviews.Title: “The most friendly helpful staff around”
Reviews.Author: Kdsbd
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to Willis Tower and the UIC Pool.

Reviews.Title: “Location isn't so great, but everything else is”
Reviews.Author: ColetteAndJim
Reviews.Content: I hop around all of the IHG properties in Chicago while I'm staying here for work, and the Holiday Inn on Harrison came due. The location isn't dreadful, but it certainly isn't close to anything. There's a Panera, Whole Foods, etc about a 6 block walk, but in January winter and 5" of snow, count me out. If you have a car, then life is good, otherwise plan on taking a cab to everything. Great fitness center on the top floor, all health club quality Precor equipment, a great multi-machine, and dumbbells up to 50lbs. Kudos to the General Manager for making the investment here. Rooms are good, very much Holiday Inn but clean and what I need. I was upgraded to a suite #437, and it's more space than I live in on a daily basis, and has a microwave, fridge, and a flat-panel TV although I don't watch it. Front desk staff is friendly, although check-in took a little longer than I would like due to several people all at once. Room is surprisingly quiet since it's so close to the freeway. Great looking business center on the top floor, looks more like an internet cafe than the typical hotel business center - very nice. I did not try the pizza joint attached to the hotel, it has looked pretty empty every time I've passed by the window. If the GM or anyone from the hotel reads the reviews on TA - The WiFi is pretty slow, and could use a bandwidth upgrade. Find out whatever the Crowne Plaza on Huron has, and make the investment into the same pipe. It would also be nice to have coffee in the lobby. Jim & Colette http://www.roamingtogether.com http://www.facebook.com/followrt

Reviews.Title: “A great location and a very friendly and helpful hotel”
Reviews.Author: OussamaSalah
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay, the staff are friendly and helpful. The rooms are a little old especially the heating system ( a little bit noisy). Amenities are great. Most important it has very good pillows

Reviews.Title: “Staff made our stay pleasant and enjoyable.”
Reviews.Author: d2_1948
Reviews.Content: The staff at your hotel are truly exceptional, especially Lakisha and Harold. They truly go the extra mile to help customers have a very enjoyable hotel visit. I have been traveling on my job for almost 50 years and have never written a review or wanted to, until now.If all hotel staff were as friendly and helpful as Lakisha and Harold are, travelling would be so much more pleasurable.

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience”
Reviews.Author: Bronislava_10
Reviews.Content: Convenient location, friendly staff, large and clean room.

Reviews.Title: “Very Accomodating”
Reviews.Author: Mary2273
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel before - mostly because it is 4 blocks from Union Station (I can exit out the doors of Union station and see it) and I can walk ito the hotel when I take the train. and it is right on the subway line. I visited my son in Chicago this past weekend; I arrived noon on Saturday and planned to leave on the 7:30am train Sunday morning. There is an hour difference between where I live and Chicago and I forgot the time change when getting ready for the train. I checked out, missed my train, returned back to the hotel and they allowed me to go back to my room and hang out until it was time to make my next train. I could have stayed all day and they didn't charege me. SO ACCOMODATING. Thank you Holiday Inn for making what could have been a very long day, wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “excelent servace”
Reviews.Author: leosee
Reviews.Content: maybee free coffee in lobby in am. but the staff is great, they go out of there way to make sure you are comfortable. and a great location for what i need, leon s

Reviews.Title: “Located rIght next to the subway; friendy staff”
Reviews.Author: kOps210
Reviews.Content: Staff was very friendly. Recommend that you include breakfast. The restaurant is good for any meal, and kids eat free. Restaurant staff was very friendly, especially with our 4- and 6-year old. Rooms are comfortable. We did experience a slight Chicago-sewer smell in our room, but you got used to it. Its location right next to the Blue Line station (Clinton stop) made travel without a vehicle very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, for great price”
Reviews.Author: Jake060
Reviews.Content: This was the first time I stayed at this Holiday Inn but would stay there again. The staff was very friendly and helpful, both in the hotel and restaurant. The restaurant had great pizza and a great bkfst buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: nchamps99
Reviews.Content: I was so impressed by the excellent service I received from the staff workers at the Holiday Inn this past week. They accommodated every request I had. They upgraded my room, had a brand new gym (small but equipped), had transportation waiting within in minutes of my request and was on point with any luggage or room needs. I would definitely recommend a suite at the Holiday Inn. It was very roomy with 2 new flat screen TV's a kitchenette fully stocked, nice bathroom and King size bedroom.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to be!”
Reviews.Author: chrisreilly22
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel over 10 times in 2 years. The staff are great, the loation is great, the restuarant is excellent... you can't go wrong- and what a great price too!

Reviews.Title: “Most customer friendly staff anywhere”
Reviews.Author: Don1214
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel many times. The rates are competitive, facility is clean and comfortable but the one thing that stands out the most is the knowledgeable, helpful, friendly staff. Consistently the best customer service Iâ€™ve experienced in a very long time.

Reviews.Title: “Decent...for the Price.”
Reviews.Author: imsonot
Reviews.Content: I came into Chicago on the train, and the Holiday Inn Chicago Downtown is only 3 blocks from Union Station -- an easy walk, and no cab needed. A diner featured on "Diners, Dives & Drive-Ins" is a 1/2 mile walk away, an "Al's Beef" is a mile away, and the Willis Tower (formerly the Sears Tower) is 3/4 mile away. However, most of the attractions like Navy Pier, the aquarium and the Science Museum are over 3 miles away -- a $10 cab ride each way. The Holiday Inn is also 1/2 mile from a Whole Foods store, which came in handy when I refused to pay $7 for a toast-apple-OJ breakfast, or $9 for the same thing with an egg -- I walked to the store, picked up some yummy pumpkin-spice muffins, bottles of orange juice and a bag of pretzels to snack on for the two nights I was there. The hotel is rated 3 stars by Priceline, and I wonder why, because it was pretty standard chain-hotel stuff. Basic room, with no microwave or fridge; tiny bathroom; tv; bed; chair; desk. The lobby was small and non-ornate. Valet parking was $30/day, but the parking lot directly adjacent to the hotel had a big "$18/night" sign displayed. My room smelled like stale cigarette smoke, the A/C never actually turned on, and the bottom of the bathroom door was kinda splintered. WiFi is free throughout the hotel, and was basically decent, though I did have a few sporadic connection issues. It was really no better than an average chain hotel room, I don't get the rating, although if I craned my neck, I could see the Sears..er, Willis Tower from my room. I will say that the attached fitness room was well stocked -- not just the usual 2 treadmills and an exercycle of most hotels, but a half-dozen workout machines, including nautilus. Their business center served my needs as well, as I printed out several documents on their laser printer at no extra charge. They have a neat rooftop pool, but it was drained, covered and locked off when I was there. Aurelio's Pizza, the restaurant attached to the hotel, is a mixed bag. The first night I had a pasta dish that was, frankly, bad. I never knew there was such a thing as "meat powder" until I ordered their pasta with meat sauce that had no actual pieces of meat in it. However, the pizza I ordered the 2nd night was fabulous -- fresh toppings, real cheese, awesome sauce, and their 10" "Super Six" had to have weighed three pounds. I think the best feature of the hotel really is the staff...they were all great. I arrived at 11:00 am...way before the 3pm check-in time...but they had a room for me. They called countless taxi cabs for me, which usually arrived within 90 seconds of calling them. They held my bag after I checked out, and they were unfailingly friendly. And in the final equation, I got this room through Priceline for $85/night...which is the great equalizer for a decent, clean downtown Chicago hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: BeMySamaritan
Reviews.Content: This is an older Holiday Inn & Suites. But very nicely kept and clean. The staff is outstanding, over-the-top friendly. This was the cheapest 2-room suite in downtown Chicago, which is why we chose this hotel. It's not luxury but it's nice. Our room had 2 large-screen TV's, a refrigerator, and a micro-wave oven. Wireless internet was fast. This hotel is not walking distance to Navy Pier or to the shopping district but it is walking distance to several great restaurants and coffee shops. It's also connected to a great pizza restaurant where we ate 3 times. They served a great breakfast too. Overall this was a great value as we saved several hundreds dollars over a long weekend vs. other downtown Chicago suite hotels. We'd return.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: Ratfacegirl
Reviews.Content: We ended up here after a snafu with reservations elsewhere. I was worried, but as we had no other choice we took the hotel room. We were very pleased with the service and the hotel itself. Although we were near NOTHING as far as walking to a place for food, the pizza at the hotel restaurant was very good. I would recommend eating there-but it's pretty slow service. That, however, seems to be the norm for Chicago as everywhere we ate that weekend was slow service! The desk folks were very nice and check in was easy. They gave us a $20 voucher for breakfast, which was a plus. Parking in an open lot just next door to the hotel was about $19 for the night. The pool is on the top of the building (we were glad to even have a pool!) and pretty chilly--but the view was GREAT! City buildings at night and a full moon made the swim fun for our son. The room itself was very clean and had Bath and Body soap and shampoo, which was nice. They even have a pillow "menu" for you if you need a particular type! There was also free wi-fi for us. Some hotels in Chicago charge extra for that! All in all, it was a fine room for a Chicago trip. I only wish we had been closer to the parks or downtown.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing service”
Reviews.Author: fiesta_xie
Reviews.Content: Very long check in process, I have to wait in line for half an hour with only 2 check in guests ahead... If you use debit card, the process to refund the deposit takes 5-10 days. I reserved a non-smoking room but got a smoking one, don't want to go through the long check-in process again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: mrozin
Reviews.Content: This isn't the fanciest hotel I've ever stayed in, but one of the best for customer service. They know how to treat their guests! I was a little worried since we got such a bargain rate through Priceline, but we had a clean, comfortable and quiet room which is all we really needed since we spent most of the day and evening out in the city. We did use the pool once and found the pool and pool area clean and stocked with clean towels. It is a short walk from the CTA and Union Station, and in 10 minutes you are in the downtown area. The hotel is only 3 blocks away from a Whole Foods Market which is convenient, too. I can't say enough about the staff and how friendly and helpful they are. I was greeted by every employee I came in contact with during our stay. The room could use a little fresh paint and newer curtains, but it certainly didn't ruin our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Decent - yet average - hotel.”
Reviews.Author: LollyNYC
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel for the price. Close to Union Station but not near any attractions or shopping areas...however the Clinton stop on the Blue Line is nearby (a two minute walk) and from there it's just a few minutes to the Mag Mile, bus tours, and other dreadful tourist faves. Aurelio's is the restaurant right downstairs - they make a great chicken sandwich but it's WAY overpriced (more than $12 for a sandwich and soda; I live in NYC so trust me, I know overpriced). The room was a decent size and the bed was big and comfortable. Pretty clean though the bathroom could have used some work. I usually travel in the mornings and try to get early check-in at most places I stay; maybe it was bad timing on my part but it wasn't available here (though to be fair, I arrived on a Friday and was told that every hotel in the city was sold out). The front desk staff was very helpful however, and whenever I needed a cab they were on it right away and I had one within minutes. Internet access was included. Parking available but not sure if it's included (they also have a valet service). If you're on a higher floor be prepared to wait for an elevator...they're very slow and were usually full by the time they got to me. All in all, it was a pleasant stay. Nothing majorly wrong yet nothing super awesome about the place either. Could use some updating, and yeah, the location isn't GREAT but it really isn't difficult to get to where you need to be.

Reviews.Title: “Long Day on Train... Nice night"s sleep...Priceless”
Reviews.Author: SuburbanSam0520
Reviews.Content: Spent a very long day on the train, I was delayed at making my connection. Didn't get in until almost midnight and I was checked in and in my room in less than 15minutes. Room was nice and cold and the bed was clean, crisp and very comfy! One there for one night didn't get to experiance any of the other amenities but my stay was excellent1 I will be staying here again, just a short walk from the train station and the location for enjoying all Chicago has to offer was perfect. Thanks from a weary traveler!

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth It!”
Reviews.Author: DGURL_10
Reviews.Content: I was displeased with this hotel for the money that I spent. The travel agent lied and said that everything was in walking distance this was not true at all.The staff was nice.The restaurant was too expensive 11.00 bucks for a breakfast buffet.Gimme a break.The rooms were in neede of updating.There were visible cracks in the walls and the drapes appeared old and dusty.I had a regular room and there was no microwave or fridge.I did enjoy the roof top pool that in my three day stay i didnt see anyone maintain.All in all this was not worth my money.

Reviews.Title: “good to choose as good service&location”
Reviews.Author: kitty_zhang
Reviews.Content: goog place that near downtown, convient trafic and high quality service while a little bit noisy as near road. recommend buffet breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Good Value - Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: ninja1956
Reviews.Content: Centrally located & a good value for business travelers. Business center in room & comfortable bed with choice of pillows. Bathroom extremely small & rust stains in tub but room was clean & spacious. I was stuck with a smoking room & would not stay again unless a non-smoking room was available. Front desk staff very friendly & helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Emploees always remember who you are, very pleasent.”
Reviews.Author: Gaue
Reviews.Content: I stay in this hotel frequently the staff is incredible even if it's months between visits the don't forget you. There is a great restaurant there and it it a block away from my meeting place.

Reviews.Title: “I arrived very late at night. The check...”
Reviews.Author: kcsamd
Reviews.Content: I arrived very late at night. The check in process was quick and I was in my room in minutes. The room was clean and the bed very comfy. Great value!

Reviews.Title: “I've stayed here frequently and am treated almost like family.”
Reviews.Author: Mark44070
Reviews.Content: When in Chicago for business, I usually stay here. At times it has seemed like a 2nd home because everyone always remembers me and makes me feel welcome. There are fancier, more upscale places, but I am usually upgraded to a suite if available, the rooms and facilities are more than adequate, we get a competitive rate, and the pizza in the restaurant is excellent. Plus it is located on the western edge of downtown ("in the shadow of the Sears Tower"), so it is situated close to the major interstates, Univ. of IL at Chicago, Greektown, and most importantly it is a relatively short drive (for Chicago at least) to our plant.

Reviews.Title: “Most expensive hotel I have ever had in the whole WORLD; poor value for money”
Reviews.Author: Dr_J_999
Reviews.Content: I stayed there as I came in on the greyhound bus which is 2 blocks away and the blue line metro is one block away at Clinton. Location from these points of view worked. A bit of a walk into downtown and the bay area. On site evening meal (not run by the hotel but no option due to location - I ordered from main menu but they came after a while to say they had run out of "pork" so I selected again. Food expensive and poor value for money - but the Pizza are HUGE!! Same place for breakfast. Set breakfast at 10.95$ was the only affordable thing on the menu as coffee and cereal + fruit was more than 11$ if ordered seperately. Poor value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant”
Reviews.Author: Vatriciaann
Reviews.Content: Everything was more than what I expected. People working at the front desk was more than helpful esp. Lakisha ( she was wonderful) and Dewayne (the bartender), I give him a thumbs up. I had one problem with the plumbing in the bathroom (the commode was constantly flushing) but it was fixed within 10 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the hospital where are sons are at.”
Reviews.Author: BabyBears10
Reviews.Content: Are son had surgery in June and it was so nice to be close to Rush and not have to drive back and forth from Indiana. My husband and myself both had high stress levels due to our one son having surgery and are hotel room was such a nice place to relax. The beds and pillows were excellent and the room was very spacious. The staff were very helpful and pleasant as well. The resturant had great food and worked out great for us having to get up and go to the hospital to be able to eat at the hotel first and quickly. The only thing I would say I didn't like was the price .... it was a bit much for a hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Decent experience”
Reviews.Author: coolbreeze1st
Reviews.Content: Good location, good stay, good service. I would recommend this hotel. Do not expect any frills but the place is clean. Free internet was a plus!

Reviews.Title: “Not the most impressed I've ever been with your services”
Reviews.Author: akeiber
Reviews.Content: I've only had two mediocre experiences with Holiday Inn and this was one of them. The web painted a much better picture of the Hotel location and condition that what I actually received. I think this is a consistant experiance that I've had with each stay in larger metropolitain areas. I would not recommend this hotel location to anyone in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and comfortable hotel.”
Reviews.Author: tebaldwin
Reviews.Content: We found the staff to be very accomodating, the rooms clean and comfortable and the bed very comfortable after a long day of baseball games and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Average-Cab Ride to Everything”
Reviews.Author: Missbhavn
Reviews.Content: My flight arrived early so I headed to the hotel to drop my bags. I asked if I could check in and was told there were no rooms available just yet , it was 12:30 pm. I asked if they could hold my bags and that I would back later in the evening to go to my room. I was assured there would be no problem. I arrived back at the hotel at 9:30 to find they had no record of me in the system that I was not registered despite a confirmation # and they did have my bags. I told them about trying to check in earlier when they finally figured out the earlier desk manager had accidentally deleted my reservation. It took me another 30 minutes while they figured out what to do as there were no rooms. Finally got to my room that was near the ice machine and across from the elevator needless to say no sleep. The room was average, the bathroom needed a good cleaning and a cab ride was required to go anywhere. Not the nicest area but walking distance to the Sears Tower and a Starbucks. Good Luck on a Speedy, Seamless Check -in

Reviews.Title: “Bugs”
Reviews.Author: Don1214
Reviews.Content: There were bugs in the bathroom and on the desk. Other then bugs, the room was OK, bed was comfortable. Fitness center was in good condition as was the business center. The staff were excellent. Friendly, knowledgeable, helpful and welcoming. Parking was expensive. Valets were pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “very confortable”
Reviews.Author: railzspice
Reviews.Content: the girl at the desk was awesome very helpful with directions any questions we had the room and pool was very nice the door boy got us a cab he had them there quick while taking care meny guest i stay in meny hotels and this one is one of the best in all areas 2 thumbs up to holiday inn in chicago

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, not the best location”
Reviews.Author: andyjansy
Reviews.Content: A really nice stay at this hotel in downtown Chicago. It is only a short walk from Union Station which is very convenient if you do not have a car â€“ it is also only about 15-20 minutes walk from the centre and all the attractions, shops,etc. The CTA station (Clinton) is right outside and it took just under an hour to get to Oâ€™Hare airport when we left. The only real downside to the hotel is the rather scruffy alleyway under the expressway you have to walk through to get to the centre of town. The room we had was quite small but perfectly adequate; it was quiet even though we were on the second floor with the expressway outside. The restaurant was also only adequate; we went out for all our meals after the first night. They also have a rooftop pool which unfortunately does not open till Memorial Day; the temperature was 90 the week before so that would have been good. Next time I think I would probably choose somewhere nearer downtown but this is perfectly acceptable at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “overall not bad”
Reviews.Author: numike
Reviews.Content: I searched for weeks to find an affordable one night stay the first Thursday in June and ended up with this property through priceline and was very happy with my night stay. Surprisingly quiet and the room was acceptable. Do not expect all the bells and whistles but for one night it served my needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and nice room”
Reviews.Author: robertalesi
Reviews.Content: Excellent staff-very friendly and helpful from the bellhop to the front desk. Awesome price on Priceline.com. Suite was very comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel with Reasonable Budget Rates”
Reviews.Author: AnupMehta
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel 2 times & I have found this quite good place with raesonable size rooms & good facilities. Centrally located-all city attractions within 4-5 miles range. Breakfast in Restaurant on ground floor is really good with Dinner options of Pizaa & Pastas. Will come back anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Very good service but needs updating for a business center for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Spike2010
Reviews.Content: The service at checkin and check out was very prompt and efficient as was the paking valet bringing my car. Could use a business center with computers & printers. Location was ok but didn't feel safe in walking past the boarded up buildings when returning from drop off point from I.R.A.Convention. Felt the pricing was a little high considering location and lack of some services.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the Willis Tower and reasonably priced.”
Reviews.Author: lmajerchin
Reviews.Content: The location was ideal for my business meetings and the staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: oehlerdude15
Reviews.Content: Right next to the Sears (Willis) Tower and we walked right to it along with great restaurants nearby as well. Our concierge was very nice and told us of all the hot spots of interest.

Reviews.Title: “Lost my car keys when I valet parked & management was nowhere to be found.”
Reviews.Author: jkm1056
Reviews.Content: We checked in on Friday night and valet parked at the hotel. The next day when we were checking out, the front desk lost our car keys. The young front desk agent was very nice and nervous b/c they could not find them. About 35 minutes later, I asked to speak with a manger. You would think a manger would have come to me first without asking considering they lost my keys. The manager was no help and they called for the food and beverage manager. He was very helpful and tried to locate my keys. After a few hours of them looking, we called the Chicago Police to file a report that our keys have been stolen or lost in case my car came up stolen. Since the last person that had my keys was a hotel employee, they also had access to my address. If my car came up missing I needed proof my keys were stolen. Luckily we had a spare set of keys and were able to make it home. Several hours after returning home the food and beverage manager called and they found my keys. He was kind enough to personally drive them to me the next day. Today (two days after checking out) I called to talk to the GM of the hotel and let him know that the food & beverage manager was a big help and that I was upset about them losing my keys but more upset I had to ask for a manager. The GM never returned my call. Basically, the hotel mangers are not hands on and did not take the time to talk to me regarding them losing my keys. I would have thought the front desk manager would have spoke to me before I had to ask for a manger and that the GM would have returned my call. I commend the food & beverage manager for taking over the situation ... a situation that the front desk manager should have handled. I do not recommend staying at this hotel b/c hotel management does not care enough to assist in house guests or return calls. The hotel Loosing my keys was a very stressful situation and I do not appreciate the way this hotel management handled it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Trip Turned Bad”
Reviews.Author: grammie18
Reviews.Content: My sisters and I came to Chicago to stay the night because we were going to go to The Oprah Winfrey Show early the next morning. We checked in at 7:00pm and at 8:30pm my sister noticed a bed bug in her bed!!!! Oh my goodness. We all freaked out. Before we called down to the front desk, we wanted to make sure that it was a bed bug so we looked up a picture/information on my laptop and sure enough it was a bed bug. I called down to the front desk and they apologized for the inconvenience and moved us to a different room. After we moved to another room, my sister was still so grossed out from the previous room she could barely sleep. We were all gonna shower the night before and the shower was disgusting. It was so dirty that we couldn't even shower. The toilet ran the entire night and wouldn't turn off. We woke up at 5:15am to get ready to leave the hotel by 6:00am. My sister went to the bathroom and as soon she flushed the water decided to go EVERYWHERE! the water was leaking from underneath the toilet so fast that the whole bathroom floor was soaked with water within a few minutes. I had to call down to the front desk 3 times for someone to come up and try to stop the water. We had to try and get all of our stuff out of there and by the time someone finally came to the room(which was a security guard), the water was already going out of the bathroom and soaking through the carpet. The staff just acted very nonchalant through the whole thing. We were trying to rush around the hotel to get ready with one little mirror since we couldn't get in the bathroom. We were late to Oprah and just made it to the studio in time. It was beyond a terrible stay. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Missed my connection”
Reviews.Author: VincentBramwell
Reviews.Content: Traveling on Amtrack to FL my train was 6 hrs late so they put up all the passenger that had a connection to DC

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, terrible breakfast. In business district so everything closed weekends”
Reviews.Author: english_b0b
Reviews.Content: Do not pay for package with breakfast included. Very expensive, very poor quality and amazingly slow (over a hour). Traffic noise very loud all night. We found that most of the local restaurants were closed the weekend we were here. Room is nice, bed great. We were upgraded to a suite.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable place - Close to Downtown”
Reviews.Author: Framingham_Traveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights. Pros: Close to Downtown. You can walk to major downtown destinations (if the weather permits). Subway station is just outside the hotel. Rooms are clean. Friendly staff. Cheaper than other comparable hotels in the area. Cons: The main lobby is very small. Looks congested when 3 or 4 guests arrive together. The building itself is pretty old. No central location for microwave, refrigerator etc. (None was available in my room so I was looking for a place where I could warm any frozen meals. Could not find any) Overall, a reasonable place for the price. Other hotels in the vicinity were much more pricier on the dates that I visited.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean hotel, convenient location, uninformed reservation employee”
Reviews.Author: JTChw
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for our first trip to Chicago. We came up for the Harry Potter exhibit at the Museum of Science & Industry - we highly recommend that for any HP fans (take the Blue Line to Jackson and then hop the #10 bus all the way to the museum)! Easy to find (right off highway 250), 1/2 a block from the Blue Line subway - so convenient! 10-15 minute walk to the Sears (er - Willis) Tower, and a little further on to downtown. The restaurant (Aurelio's) was pretty good - definitely go for the breakfast buffet! Remember to stop at the front desk for vouchers if you want to take advantage of the Kids Eat Free thing. Nice clean room, standard bathroom (but clean) and wonderfully firm beds. Fair warning, though, even if the person taking your reservation says it's okay, if you book a 2-double room, a rollaway is not permitted - apparently it's a fire hazard. The front desk employee said I'd have to upgrade to a Junior Suite to have a rollaway - $50 more per night. Oh and parking was pretty steep (but standard for the city) - skip the valet service and park yourself in the well-lit lot behind the hotel. Valet was $30 a day, we paid $23 for the weekend (24 hour $18+ 12 hour $5).

Reviews.Title: “Good job Holiday Inn!”
Reviews.Author: Legsfamily
Reviews.Content: This Holiday Inn was very clean, quiet, and friendly! It was within walking distance from Union Station in Chicago. The room was big and comfortable. It had a small bench/chair, a desk chair and a "comfy" chair. It was nice to be able to sit in a chair instead of always on a bed. The pool on the rooftop was an added bonus. The water was a little chilly, but this summer has been very chilly. We could see the Willis Tower from the pool/rooftop. The hotel sat next to the Eisenhower Expressway, but it was barely heard from our 4th floor room. We walked to Union Station every morning and caught city buses to the attractions we wanted to see. The conceirges were very helpful and friendly!!! We had a great time at the Holiday Inn in Downtown Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price!”
Reviews.Author: purple2911
Reviews.Content: The staff in the was really nice and helpful, the hotel was very clean and the rooms were really nice too! The only thing that was disturbing was that the heater was making loud noises sometimes but everything else was great!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful amenities and a great location”
Reviews.Author: RabePaul
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights at a grand total cost of $618 for two-persons with a king bed. Room included full bath, phone, TV with 39 cable channels, temperature control, and free wi-fi. Hotel has an exercise room, an outdoor pool (available Memorial Day to Labor Day), and a computer room with two free PC's with internet access and a printer. Hotel was clean, well-maintained, and surprisingly quiet for being next to a freeway. Staff was VERY friendly and willing to assist with our visit. Within the hotel building is a chain pizza place that featured a bar, a full hot breakfast buffet (not included in room price), a pizza and pasta lunch buffet on week-days, and dinners. A convenience store was five blocks away, and several restaurants were a little beyond that. I noted that onsite, outdoor parking would be $16 per day, and nearby covered parking is $9 per day. However, since a 72 hour pass for unlimited rides on the CTA is only $12 per person, it is clearly best to not use a car when visiting Chicago. Hotel is located just a couple blocks from both the Amtrak Station and the bus station. The neighborhood is sufficiently safe that even a late night arrival would not be a problem -- just be aware of exactly how to get to the hotel, as Chicago's grid system makes all streets look alike. The hotel is also just a block from the "Clinton" stop on the CTA Blue Subway Line, meaning you can go from O'Hare Airport direct to the hotel -- and Midway Airport would require one change of train. You can easily either walk or ride the subway to the Loop, and the McCormick Center is a couple miles away. For us, the location was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: alpMichigan
Reviews.Content: This was a nice, quality hotel. The beds were a little small but comfortable. The staff made it better. This was our first trip to Chicago and they were very helpful and gave great tips. The pool is outdoors on the roof! Very nice view of Sears Tower. I thought it was supposed to be heated, but it was cold (and the weather was REALLY hot that day). Although it says "downtown" it isn't really. We had about a 10 minute walk to Union Station. I was a little nervous walking back to our hotel when it was dark (not a lot of lighting) with my small children but everything was fine. The price for parking was cheaper then other hotels (we paid $30.00). You could leave your car at the hotel until 4:00 on the day of check-out, which was really nice. Actually, the valet guy let us leave our car parked out front, let us take our keys, and just said to come get it when we could! Overall, I'd stay here again. But, it might be worth it to stay downtown so you wouldn't have to walk so much (but really, the walking wasn't that bad... and I've never stayed downtown so those are just my thoughts) :)

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn Canal & Harrison - Good value and safe!”
Reviews.Author: Amy C
Reviews.Content: I arrived late on Friday night, only to find that I had made my reservation for arrival on Saturday. Kisha at the front desk cheerfully assured me that they had rooms, and got me squared away promptly with a joke and a smile. Every time she saw me thereafter she greeted me by name. The customer service at this hotel is top rate. There are always at least two concierge/bellmen ready to provide directions, call a cab (very quickly too!), or carry a bag for you. One of them even gave me a quarter when I was rooting through my purse for change for the newspaper. The desk staff is pleasant and very helpful. They met all of my needs very well. The room was nice. Clean, basic amenities, quiet even though the hotel is located right off interstate 290. Holiday Inn has a pillow menu, and there are three pillows on the bed. Nice quality toiletries in the bath (shampoo, conditioner, body soap, face soap, and lotion) but I do not like the smell of mint - not their fault. Good pressure and hot water in the shower. The penthouse (top floor) contains a workout area, a business center, and a rooftop outdoor pool. The pool was indeed chilly at 8:30 a.m., but in the afternoon the sun warmed it considerably. Neat to swim outside on the roof during the air show - good views. The business center was a computer and a printer - both worked well and quickly. Fast internet. The workout room has several good quality machines (treadmills, stairmasters, ellipticals) and televisions to view while working out. Everyone I met that worked for the hotel greeted me with what came across as sincere pleasure to see me, and made eye contact when saying hello or asking how to help. Onsite pizza restaurant was good enough - the waitstaff there was very friendly and accomodating. Prices were good - pizza was okay, but the breadsticks were quite good. There is also a small chicken and fish place next door - independently owned. Parking is $30 valet, or $16 to self park. Do the self park, the lot is just next door the hotel. It's not necessarily guarded, there are the usual caveats about your stuff, but I overlooked that lot and it was well lit at night. The hotel is a bit off the beaten path, but I walked downtown in 20 minutes, easily. It is near enough by cab to the Museum Campus. Cabs were quickly hailed by the bellmen, and are plentiful everywhere. They are also required to take credit cards in Chicago. You need to be firm with some of them about this, but they are. I will stay here again in November. I enjoyed the two night stay and found it to be a good value for the money, and a pleasant weekend lodging.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel.. not a lot to do!”
Reviews.Author: drbabbers
Reviews.Content: Went for this hotel as it was right near the Amtrak station, you can literally walk from the station to the hotel, although it is a little difficult to see and get to. Just ask if you are stuck, but don't waste money on a cab! The hotel itself was OK. The room was clean and tidy. For some reason we had a disabled suite, so the shower was always leaking onto the bathroom floor and we had to laydown towels on a regular basis to keep out feet dry. But the room was good. Not a lot of noise going on, so a good nights sleep had each night. No complaints about the room, although this place was a little expensive. There was also a rooftop pool, which was the coldest pool I have ever swam in! Literally freezing.. nice pool area though and if the water was warm would have been fantastic. Nice views from the roof of the surrounding buildings. The main issue was that there was nothing to do really immediately at the hotel. You can walk down St Canal St about 10 minutes and you hit some shops and supermarkets, ideal for some shopping or food. There is a bus stop at Union Station, so you can commute for 2 dollars to the main attractions that Chicago has to offer. I would recommend spending a day at Navy Pier, which is easy to get to by bus. Overall I would only recommend this hotel if you want convenient access to the Amtrak Union Station and are willing to get buses to see anything decent in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn, Chicago”
Reviews.Author: PMG
Reviews.Content: Great service, clean rooms, friendly staff. They helped us get around the city, made recommendations for restaurants, and overall were a great help.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraLA
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay . Good tidy rooms and great friendly staff always ready to help. Problem with air conditioning unit in room but sorted straight away to an upgraded room. Washing machine and tumble dryer very handy when on 2 week holiday. Swimming pool small but still used every day while sons used gym. Quite a walk to centre but on holiday so good to explore. Extra charge for breakfast but very good.

Reviews.Title: “Rather pleasant”
Reviews.Author: laurrrenk
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here. The rooms are very clean, comfortable and nicely decorated. The staff were very kind and helpful. And the restaurant located within the hotel was wonderful, they make great pizza! Only downside was the location. As a young female travelling alone I did not feel safe walking around the area, and definitely not at night. There really isn't anything or anyone around. I was warned by my aiport transfer driver about this however so I organised a bus tour to get around which was excellent. Apparently the Mart Plaza Holiday Inn has the best location (according to this driver who seemed to know all there is to know about Chicago)

Reviews.Title: “Better than Expected”
Reviews.Author: RLW40
Reviews.Content: After booking on Priceline and paying a low rate for this hotel we were happy with the 3 star accommodations. The Holiday Inn Hotel and Suites downtown Chicago was easy to get to off of 290. The staff were very friendly and answered all our questions. Room was clean and just as pictured on the hotels website but bathrooms are small. Also, Lobby area is small and can get crowded. We purchased CTA visitor passes and used the train/bus service which was convenient to the hotel. Clinton Stop (Blue LIne), is just accross the street. We visited American Girl, John Hancock, Field Museum and Shedds. Found the trasportation very easy to use but will find something closer to downtown next visit. The hotel parking is $30 a day. However, we chose to park in the parking lot next to the hotel and paid $20 a day with in/out privileges. Our room overlooked the parking lot and we could see our vehicle. Also, we were directed to buy our visitors passes at the customer service desk of the Dominicks grocery store that was just 3 blocks away on Roosevelt between Clinton and Canal streets. Parking is free at Dominicks and there is a Walgreens, Subway sandwich shop, and a Dominos Pizza in the same shopping center.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but find something in a better location”
Reviews.Author: 1Meech
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights during Labour Day Weekend. Very friendly and helpful staff. Room was clean, carpet freshly steam cleaned (still damp), but the bathroom could have been cleaner. I would find a hotel in a better location the next time I go to Chicago. $10 US cab rides with tip to get downtown. Walking downtown during the day was OK (safe), about 15 to 20 minutes to Michigan Ave, but I would recommend taking a cab at night. There are no attractions or restaurants close by (pizza joint attached to hotel, but did not try it - go to Gino's instead). If you plan on spending most of your time in the downtown area it is worth it to find something in a better location.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: TravellinMofo
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because it said on the Holiday Inn site that it's only 1.5 miles from the United Center....more like 3 miles! Next to impossible to find food near here. Lobby was terribly small. ANTS IN MY ROOM!?! Yes, that's right...I had to fight ants to use the bathroom. Room was by the stairs that lead to the pool, and everytime the a/c came on the lovely smell of chlorine filled the room. Bed not comfortable. Website didn't mention that this hotel is under some renovation and work started at 8am every day. Ugh. Also, noise from the street is extremely loud! I felt like the room was dirty - I didn't want to touch the dingy floor with my bare feet. I paid almost $200 for the quality of a $60 room. Unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price & location”
Reviews.Author: ILteacher
Reviews.Content: I made the reservation of this hotel blindly through a "name your price" site and they accepted my offer of $100/night. The top floor of the hotel (6th floor) featured an outdoor rooftop pool which seemed clean and well maintained, a workout room and a game room. The location - close to UIC on the very edge of the downton/Loop area was right off of Interstate 290. CTA train & bus stops were nearby which made the location easily accessible. The king bed wasn't very comfortable, but I've slept on worse. My biggest complaint was that the lobby was very small. It was always jam packed each time I walked through. The room was spacious and the a/c worked well. I would stay there again if I could get the $100 rate. At $199, I believe it's a bit too pricey for the quality and location. Parking was valet only for $30. I would say this hotel would be best for families, as it's not far from the mag mile and the wonderful downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but location is a worry”
Reviews.Author: johnjan6410
Reviews.Content: Myself and wife stayed one night at this hotel recently, the rooms are large, clean and comfortable and staff friendy and helpful but we were not comfortable with the area, we thought our phobias may be due to the fact that we live in a small town here in Australia but after reading other reviews realise we are not alone in thinking the location could have been better. Fortunately it has a restaurant which was too our liking as we would have gone hungry rather than venture out after dark in that neighbourhood. However it is close to the Sears Tower & Union Station. In all the hotel is very nice it's just a shame they built it where they did.

Reviews.Title: “Great family vacation home base”
Reviews.Author: CR0726
Reviews.Content: Just what you'd expect in a Holiday Inn. Nothing fancy but large, clean rooms with extra friendly staff (maybe it's that Midwestern hospitality). Plenty of amenities for the vacationing family like a laundry room, fitness room, rooftop pool (nice after a long day of sightseeing). Convenient restaurant, though prices and pizza were better elsewhere. The hotel is located in a downtown business area that pretty much rolls up the sidewalks evenings and weekends, but that didn't matter to us because we were hardly there. Convenient to public transportation-- Blue subway line is on the corner and Sears Tower, where you can pick up the free trolley to shopping and attractions, is a 3-block walk, plus we had no problem getting taxis to and from the hotel. The free high-speed wireless Internet access was great and for those who don't travel with laptop, there's a computer and printer in the lobby guests can use for free. Very handy for printing out boarding passes before heading to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, but location could be better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Pros: Large room size, comfortable bed, nice furniture, good housekeeping, newspaper delivered to door, vending in good location (near elevators), staff checked ID when paying with credit card, quality soap and shampoo, calming rooftop penthouse (outdoor pool and deck, arcade, exercise room). Cons: Deadbolt in room did not work; receipt put under door essentially looked like a blank piece of paper (must have been having printer problems); noxious smell from heater when I tried to warm up the room (perhaps it had not been used in a while -- it was July, after all); area felt a little secluded and unsafe (a big change from just a couple of blocks away); dripping faucet in bathroom; vending machine did not return my change; traffic noise (busy roads nearby); occasional slight vibration in a wall in room; service at restaurant was slow and haphazard.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & confortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: HolidayDreamz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Holiday Inn Downtown in June 2005. The location was terrible as it is located at a dangerous part of Chicago. Cabs did come to the hotel but I had some cab drivers who warned me not to wander around as it was reknowned to be 'not safe'. The room was very comfortable & the housekeeping staff did an excellent job each and every time they cleaned my room. Great job! No shops close by. There is only a Dominicks & Walgreens about 4 blocks away. Not a good idea to walk all the way bearing fruits/groceries. Especially when no cabs will stop for you there.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First time in the Windy City, I was a little bit worried but this was a nice hotel. Everything was clean and the staff were helpful. The little pizzeria/breakfast diner was good downstairs. We couldnt have wished for better for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience!”
Reviews.Author: AlwaysOnVacation
Reviews.Content: This is the most unenjoyable hotel experience I have ever had. After arriving at this hotel in late May and discovering it was "on the wrong side of the tracks", we were a bit skeptical. I felt very out of place here, as the hotel is not nice and is in a very trashy part of town. However, we decided to give it a chance, since we had gotten a decent rate and it was pretty close to the Sears Tower. My husband left for his business meeting there and I decided to wait for our room to be ready, since we had arrived early. Before he left for the meeting, we were told we could indeed check in early and would only have to wait 30 minutes or so in the lobby. So, I told him to go on to his meeting and I would wait. How nice, I though, an early check in....7 hours later, I was STILL IN THE LOBBY! Their computer system crashed, then there was a "problem" with our reservation. The list of excuses went on and on. So, I had the pleasure of watching noisy school groups come and go and found out that our "suite" hotel plays host to traffic school! Dozens upon dozens of angry drivers filled the lobby waiting for their classes to start and stood around swapping horror stories in amongst guests trying to check in. I was not impressed! Finally, my husband and his associates finished their meeting, but we never made it to our room! We checked out without ever checking in and made our way to a nicer part of town! Don't let the pictures fool you. It isn't that close to the Sears Tower. My husband said they walked quite a while, through the bad neighborhood we were in to get there. The W Chicago City Center is a lot closer to the tower and a lot nicer. One last tip, stay on the opposite side of the canal/river that is behind the hotel. This seems to be the dividing line between the trashy/classy sides of Chicago. Enjoy your stay in the Windy City-Just enjoy it somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was given one of the suites at this hotel and was pleasantly suprised with the cleaniness of the room. I, however, thought the pillows shouldn't have been so hard, yet the stay was nice. I would also suggest double sheeting the beds as one never knows who has been there prior.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, resonable price but a bit out of center”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, reasonable price, reasonably quiet - providing you get a room that doesn't face onto the main highway behind the building. Liked the pool on the roof. Its a little way out of the center, but handy for the Sears tower. Well served by CTA metro ($1.5 from airport direct to hotel!) and by Chicago free trolleys. Not much choice of resturants nearby, but hotel cafe OK for breakfast.
